content.raw:
The old school bash boys used to say: eval is evil. We can play with some escapes and probably something like this:

```
#!bash
sudo sh -c "echo \"deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu ${codename} main\" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gazebo_install-latest.list"
```

should work and avoid the use of eval.
content.html:
The old school bash boys used to say: eval is evil. We can play with some escapes and probably something like this:

sudo sh -c "echo \"deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu ${codename} main\" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gazebo_install-latest.list"

should work and avoid the use of eval.

pull_request.title: Scripts for the new gazebo website

pullrequest.title: Scripts for the new gazebo website

content.raw:
I have some love to the good ```case``` bash structure ...
 
```
#!bash
case $codename in
    precise | quantal | raring | saucy)
    ;;
    *)
        echo "This script will only work on Ubuntu precise, quantal, raring, or saucy."
        exit
esac
```
content.html:
I have some love to the good case bash structure ...

case $codename in
    precise | quantal | raring | saucy)
    ;;
    *)
        echo "This script will only work on Ubuntu precise, quantal, raring, or saucy."
        exit
esac
